items.title: Stolen Data: National PTA Database Available on Dark Web | UpGuard
items.content: On May 13th, UpGuard discovered a new set of data recently posted on a prominent dark web forum, this time allegedly belonging to the National Parent Teacher Association.
items.contentSnippet: On May 13th, UpGuard discovered a new set of data recently posted on a prominent dark web forum, this time allegedly belonging to the National Parent Teacher Association.

items.title: By Design: How Default Permissions on Microsoft Power Apps Exposed Millions | UpGuard
items.content: 38 million records were exposed in multiple data leaks resulting from misconfigured Microsoft Power Apps portals. Data included sensitive information such as COVID-19 contact tracing data, COVID-19 vaccination appointments, social security numbers for job applicants, employee IDs, and millions of names and email addresses.
items.contentSnippet: 38 million records were exposed in multiple data leaks resulting from misconfigured Microsoft Power Apps portals. Data included sensitive information such as COVID-19 contact tracing data, COVID-19 vaccination appointments, social security numbers for job applicants, employee IDs, and millions of names and email addresses.

items.content: The UpGuard Cyber Risk Team has discovered and secured a data exposure of documents appearing to describe GoDaddy infrastructure running in the Amazon AWS cloud, preventing any future exploitation of this information.

items.title: Out of Pocket: How an ISP Exposed Administrative System Credentials | UpGuard
items.content: ISPs do more than provide internet service for individual customers-- they can also act as part of US critical infrastructure. See how one ISP exposed their administrative and root passwords to the public.
items.contentSnippet: ISPs do more than provide internet service for individual customers-- they can also act as part of US critical infrastructure. See how one ISP exposed their administrative and root passwords to the public.

items.title: Public Option: How Medical Records and Patient-Doctor Recordings Were Exposed | UpGuard
items.content: The intersection of information technology and healthcare creates new and improved functionality for managing and delivering healthcare services, but it also entails new risks. See how one telemedicine company exposed thousands of medical records and hundreds of patient-doctor recordings online.

items.title: Open Enrollment: How HCL Exposed Employee Passwords and Project Data | UpGuard
items.content: The UpGuard data breach research team discovered and secured leaks from IT services provider HCL, including new employee passwords.
items.contentSnippet: The UpGuard data breach research team discovered and secured leaks from IT services provider HCL, including new employee passwords.

items.title: Debt Collection: How an Unsecured ElasticSearch Instance Exposed Thousands of Borrowers | UpGuard
items.content: UpGuard can now report an ElasticSearch instance used as data storage for the debt collection system ENCollect has been secured. The server contained data about loans from multiple Indian and African financial services companies that had apparently been sent to ENCollect for collection. The data totalled 5.8GB in storage size and contained a total of 1,686,363 records. Those records included personal information like name, loan amount, date of birth, account number, and more.
items.contentSnippet: UpGuard can now report an ElasticSearch instance used as data storage for the debt collection system ENCollect has been secured. The server contained data about loans from multiple Indian and African financial services companies that had apparently been sent to ENCollect for collection. The data totalled 5.8GB in storage size and contained a total of 1,686,363 records. Those records included personal information like name, loan amount, date of birth, account number, and more.

items.title: Overboard: How Tea Party Campaign Assets Were Exposed Online | UpGuard

items.title: Enterprise Scale: How Public Storage Buckets Leaked Private Credentials | UpGuard
items.content: Several large storage buckets under the control of Hortonworks were configured for public access, exposing credentials and other internal data.

items.title: Student Applications: How an Education Software Company Exposed Millions of Files | UpGuard
items.content: UpGuard can now report that a public Google Cloud Storage bucket containing approximately 1.5 terabytes of data used to administer funding programs for college students has been secured. The bucket belonged to SmarterSelect, a company that provides software for managing the application process for scholarships, grants, and awards. The more than 2.8 million files included documents like transcripts, resumes, personal essays, tax returns, and invoices for approximately 1.2 million applications to funding programs.
items.contentSnippet: UpGuard can now report that a public Google Cloud Storage bucket containing approximately 1.5 terabytes of data used to administer funding programs for college students has been secured. The bucket belonged to SmarterSelect, a company that provides software for managing the application process for scholarships, grants, and awards. The more than 2.8 million files included documents like transcripts, resumes, personal essays, tax returns, and invoices for approximately 1.2 million applications to funding programs.

items.title: Dark Cloud: Inside The Pentagon's Leaked Internet Surveillance Archive | UpGuard
items.content: As soon as the UpGuard Cyber Risk Team notified the Defense Department of this publicly exposed information, immediate action was taken, securing the open buckets and preventing further access.

items.title: Digital Gangsters, Disinformation and Dark Adverts: The UK Parliament DCMS Report | UpGuard
items.content: Based on UpGuard's data breach research, the UK Parliament’s DCMS Committee prepared and published the final report detailing their 18 month investigation into online disinformation and the privacy practices of platforms such as Facebook. Read about the report, and the AggregateIQ breach discovery.
items.contentSnippet: Based on UpGuard's data breach research, the UK Parliament’s DCMS Committee prepared and published the final report detailing their 18 month investigation into online disinformation and the privacy practices of platforms such as Facebook. items.title: Losing Face: Two More Cases of Third-Party Facebook App Data Exposure | UpGuard
items.content: Third-party Facebook apps gather Facebook data about the people who use them. While Facebook struggles to contain these exposures, insecure third-party data practices & misconfigured cloud systems continue to leak Facebook data to the internet. See how UpGuard discovered and secured two such cases.
items.contentSnippet: Third-party Facebook apps gather Facebook data about the people who use them. While Facebook struggles to contain these exposures, insecure third-party data practices & misconfigured cloud systems continue to leak Facebook data to the internet.
